student_exp=[]
for i in ['Q16_Part_1','Q16_Part_2','Q16_Part_3','Q16_Part_4','Q16_Part_5','Q16_Part_6','Q16_Part_7','Q16_Part_8','Q16_Part_9','Q16_Part_10','Q16_Part_11','Q16_Part_12']:
    student_exp.append(students[i].value_counts())
student_exp=pd.concat(student_exp)
plt.figure(figsize=(12,10))
plt.title('IDEs used by students')
plt.xlabel('Percentage')
plt.ylabel('IDE')
plt.barh(student_exp.index,student_exp/sum(student_exp))

source.4624c492: The above graphs shows python and deep learning skills make them to get more pay. learn it and earn more.
source.4593592f:
* Learning
* Earning
* Hiring
> are the major areas (other than patriots and feminist) in which these surveys will have greater impact (according to my little amount of knowledge).
let's see some of the insights to make impacts in those fields.
source.7bc594ff: This shows the Jupyter notebook is mostly used by the students. VS code, Pycharm, Rstudio and spyder comes next.
source.24be5455: The above graph shows that there are more than 20 percentage of people who did the survey are students who are interested in data science.
source.4f381525: I grouped the salaries into 5 groups just for similicity.
source.d20375a1: The primary hiring focus on hiring the fresher right. let's see the students and their skills in different perspective to hire them.
source.dedcfce2: Oh! 25 percentage of students does know any language at all. It shows they are thinking that programming is not needed for the data science. They need to change their minds.
source.c5685197: Google colab and kaggle notebooks are the major notebook products used by the students. Most of the students are not using any notebook products itself. This shows they prefer offline IDEs to work with.
source.8f11b166: This shows lot of very high earners are from US. India has different payscale, Other countries also. So to earn more we need to go to US. Skills of High earners are follows:
source.fa4f0be8: But Hiring data scientists or experts are very difficult. We can't say anything from this survey about that.
source.5da823c3: It's not a surprise. Python is the dominating language. SQL, R, C++ are some of the languages also used by the students.
source.b83eef2f: This shows that there are many students who are interested in data science belongs to India and US. So HR people can focus on these countries to hire the fresh data enthusiasts. But this is not enough for hiring right. So we need to analyze the skills of these people.
source.e67f6064: It's human nature to think about higher pay right. Let's see how we can make it.
source.6a1f3226: The above graphs shows that the students need to improve to meet industry standards. But more than half are almost ready to face the world of data science. They will be hired easily.
source.43c72778: This shows most of the students can work in more than 2 IDEs which industry people using nowadays. That means students can work in industry projects directly once they have been hired. But nearly 20 percentage of people not using any IDEs which shows they need to update themself.
source.b8b95bc9: Learning from other data scientists and experts. But it is different from earning. Skills to become good data scientists.
source.614a1db3: I was really shocked to see this that a student(so called) has 20+ years experience in ML but his age is from 25 to 29. I think that legend has taken his own biological NN into account. Apart from that the students are predominantly working in ML for less than one years.
source.d95aa432: The above graph shows deep learning is the bigger difference between earner and learner. So Deep learning is to be learned by the students to become a good data scientists. Thank you guys. Insights will be updated soon.
source.5aef269a: Matplotlib and seaborn are widely used by the students. Because they mostly work in python. ggplot2 and plotly comes next in this row.
